intro: Hieracium asikkalense, commonly known as the Asikkala hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features yellow to orange flowers arranged in a cluster, with slender, hairy stems and basal leaves. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and is often found in temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in certain areas.
